Description: Relief from the tomb of Ankhhaf: on the front face there are standing figures of Ankhhaf and his wife Nefertsedjmet, with their names inscribed above; on the side is a figure of Ankhhaf's son Netjeruser with a staff on the surface on the side. The piece is carved in good, sunk relief. No colour remains.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' III (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 66.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.15)
Condition: Fair; the surface is somewhat affected by salt.
